Question: Internet & Wi-Fi for domestic
Answer:
Avail free Wi-Fi service (upto 2 hours) at BLR Airport with a simple log-in process.
  1. Enable Wi-Fi and select BLR Airport free Wi-Fi.
  2. Open a web browser on your device and type any URL. You will be redirected to the Wi-Fi webpage.
  3. Fill in the required details and click on 'send OTP'
  4. Enter the OTP received and click on 'submit'.
  5. Enjoy free internet for 2 hours. Do not close the login page during this duration.
    6. If you are a registered user on pulse, then being a loyalty user you will be eligible for extended Wi-Fi. For non pulse users, the Wi-Fi disables in an hour. For a more convenient experience, you may also download the BLR Pulse App. If you require any further assistance, please reach out to our customer care at feedback@bialairport.com or call 080-66785555 / 080-47406666.

Question: Check-in procedure for domestic
Answer:
Carry your e-ticket or get your e-boarding pass at the self-check-in kiosks near departure gates.
  • Ensure that you have a valid government photo ID for security verification.
  • Proceed to the check-in counters to collect your boarding pass/drop luggage. Use self-bag drop, if applicable.
  • Show your e-boarding pass to CISF Personnel to pass-through security check.\nFor a more convenient experience, you may also download the BLR Pulse App.\n If you require any further assistance, please reach out to our customer care at feedback@bialairport.com or call 080-66785555 / 080-47406666.

Question: Check-in procedure for international
Answer:
Carry your e-ticket or get your boarding pass at the self-check-in kiosks near departure gates.
  • Ensure that you have a Passport and valid visa.
  • Proceed to the check-in counters to collect your boarding pass/drop luggage.
  • All passengers are required to clear Immigration and have their passports stamped during both arrival and departure.
  • Show your e-boarding pass to CISF Personnel to pass-through security check\nFor a more convenient experience, you may also download the BLR Pulse App.\n If you require any further assistance, please reach out to our customer care at feedback@bialairport.com or call 080-66785555 / 080-47406666.

Question: guidelines for international passengers
Answer: As per the GoI circular dated February 10, 2022, below are the revised international guidelines, effective February 14, 2022. BEFORE TRAVEL- Submit self-declaration form on Air Suvidha portal www.newdelhiairport.in, including travel details of last 14 days. Upload a negative COVID-19 RT-PCR report; test conducted within 72 hrs prior to the journey OR upload a certificate of completing full primary vaccination schedule of COVID-19 vaccination. The list of countries which have an agreement with India on mutual recognition of vaccination certificates are available on www.mohfw.gov.in. Passengers must give an undertaking on the portal or otherwise to the MoCA (GoI) through the Airline that they would abide by the decisions of the appropriate Govt authorities to undergo self-health monitoring/quarantine, as warranted. ARRIVAL AT BLR AIRPORT-Undergo Thermal screening. Show the online self-declaration form to the Airport Health Officials. 2% of the passengers will undergo random testing at BLR Airport. Such passengers will be identified by the Airlines. They will submit swab samples and exit the airport. All international passengers arriving in Bengaluru must self-monitor their health for 14 days. If they develop any symptoms of COVID-19, they must self-isolate and inform the nearest health facility or call the National/State Helpline number. Children under 5 years are exempted from both pre and post arrival\nFor a more convenient experience, you may also download the BLR Pulse App.\n If you require any further assistance, please reach out to our customer care at feedback@bialairport.com or call 080-66785555 / 080-47406666.

Please follow directional signages or speak to a traffic warden for assistance.\nFor a more convenient experience, you may also download the BLR Pulse App.\n If you require any further assistance, please reach out to our customer care at feedback@bialairport.com or call 080-66785555 / 080-47406666.

Question: Do you offer special services for differently abled passengers?
Answer: For differently abled passengers, a dedicated zone is reserved for drop-off at the Kerb near the Departure gates and pick up at the inner Kerb near Arrivals. A calling facility has been installed at the drop-off point to enable passengers to call the airline for assistance. Differently abled passengers are accorded priority at all processing points (departure gates, check-in counters, PESC and boarding gates). Passengers with reduced mobility can opt for the complimentary buggy service available at two designated locations: near Departure gates and at International security check area. Passengers can also engage a concierge and porter service. They will be assisted by staff and escorted by the porter to the check-in counter.\nFor a more convenient experience, you may also download the BLR Pulse App.\n If you require any further assistance, please reach out to our customer care at feedback@bialairport.com or call 080-66785555 / 080-47406666.

Question: Is the parking facility manual or automated?

Question: How can i access wifi at bengaluru airport?
Answer:
Avail free Wi-Fi service (upto 2 hours) at BLR Airport with a simple log-in process.
  1. Enable Wi-Fi and select BLR Airport free Wi-Fi.
  2. Open a web browser on your device and type any URL. You will be redirected to the Wi-Fi webpage.
  3. Fill in the required details and click on 'send OTP'
  4. Enter the OTP received and click on 'submit'.
  5. Enjoy free internet for 2 hours. Do not close the login page during this duration.
    6. If you are a registered user on pulse, then being a loyalty user you will be eligible for extended Wi-Fi. For non pulse users, the Wi-Fi disables in an hour. For a more convenient experience, you may also download the BLR Pulse App. If you require any further assistance, please reach out to our customer care at feedback@bialairport.com or call 080-66785555 / 080-47406666.
